Configuration

Just the Docs has some specific configuration parameters that can be defined in your Jekyll site’s _config.yml file.

Table of contents

  1. Search enabled
  2. Aux links
  3. Heading anchor links
  4. Footer content
  5. Color scheme
  6. Google Analytics

View this site’s _config.yml file as an example.

Search enabled 

# Enable or disable the site search
# Support true (default) or false
search_enabled: true

Aux links 

# Aux links for the upper right navigation
aux_links:
    "Just the Docs on GitHub":
      - "//github.com/pmarsceill/just-the-docs"

Heading anchor links 

# Heading anchor links appear on hover over h1-h6 tags
# in page content allowing users to deep link to a particular
# heading on a page.
#
# Supprts true (default) or false/nil
heading_anchors: true

Footer content 

# Footer content appears at the bottom of every page's main content
footer_content: "Copyright &copy; 2017-2019 Patrick Marsceill. Distributed by an <a href=\"https://github.com/pmarsceill/just-the-docs/tree/master/LICENSE.txt\">MIT license.</a>"

Color scheme 

# Color scheme currently only supports "dark" or nil (default)
color_scheme: "dark"

See Customization for more information.

Google Analytics 

# Google Analytics Tracking (optional)
# e.g, UA-1234567-89
ga_tracking: UA-5555555-55

Jerry Huang
